unnormalised: India's population, according to the unofficial estimates released yesterday, has crossed a whopping 142 cr! Seems like we're adding a new London every few months, folks. Experts are saying the growth rate is at 0.8%, but honestly, who's counting at this point? We're basically one giant family... a *very* large, slightly chaotic, and definitely loud family.
normalised: India's population, according to the unofficial estimates released yesterday, has crossed a whopping one hundred and forty two crore! Seems like we're adding a new London every few months, folks. Experts are saying the growth rate is at zero point eight percent, but honestly, who's counting at this point? We're basically one giant family... a very large, slightly chaotic, and definitely loud family.

unnormalised: The 2023 data also shows Uttar Pradesh leading the pack with a population of approx. 240 million, followed closely by Maharashtra at 130 million. Apparently, the "Hum Do Humare Do" slogan didnâ€™t quite catch on everywhere, huh? Maybe we should try "Hum Do Humare... a few more, no problem!" Just kidding, govt. authorities, relax! But seriously, these numbers are wilder than a Bollywood dance-off.
normalised: The two thousand and twenty three data also shows Uttar Pradesh leading the pack with a population of approximately two hundred and forty million, followed closely by Maharashtra at one hundred and thirty million. Apparently, the "Hum Do Humare Do" slogan didn't quite catch on everywhere, huh? Maybe we should try "Hum Do Humare... a few more, no problem!" Just kidding, government authorities, relax! But seriously, these numbers are wilder than a Bollywood dance-off.

unnormalised: Analysts predict we'll need, like, a million more schools, hospitals, and chai stalls. Good news for entrepreneurs, I guess? And congrats to all the new additions to our already bursting-at-the-seams nation. Just remember to share that last samosa, okay? Census data released on 01/01/2024 by the Census Bureau of India showed that the female to male ratio has increased to 1020 females per 1000 males. Now thats something to really smile about and celebrate.
normalised: Analysts predict we'll need, like, a million more schools, hospitals, and chai stalls. Good news for entrepreneurs, I guess? And congrats to all the new additions to our already bursting-at-the-seams nation. Just remember to share that last samosa, okay? Now that's something to really smile about and celebrate.
